steps.step: Soak the beans (optional): Rinse and sort the beans, discarding any stones or shriveled beans. You can soak the beans overnight in cold water (cover with several inches of water) OR pour enough boiling water over them to cover by a few inches and soak them for an hour OR skip the pre-soaking step.
Soaking will speed up the cooking process. If you soak, discard the soaking liquid after soaking.
Add beans to a large pot with 2 1/2 quarts (10 cups) of water.
Add oregano, bay leaves, and sage. Bring the beans to a boil and reduce heat to a simmer.

Cook until the beans are soft, but not quite done. The time will vary depending on how large, dry, or old your beans are, and if you have pre-soaked them, from anywhere from 30 minutes to an hour and a half.
Sauté onions and peppers, add spices: While the beans are cooking, sauté onions and peppers in olive oil until soft.
Add chili sauce, chili powder, and/or chili purée, cumin, and garlic. Sauté until spices are fragrant.
Fish out and discard the bay leaves, stems of oregano, and sage leaves from the pot of beans.
Remove, but reserve, extra cooking liquid until there is about 1/2-inch of liquid above beans.
Add the onion mixture and salt to the pot of beans. Cook another hour or so until thickened.
Add half of the orange juice, and simmer. Adjust chili heat at this point – you may or may not want to add more of your chili paste.
Just before serving, add remaining orange juice, lime juice, and vinegar. Salt to taste.
Serve with corn tortillas, and/or rice, sour cream, and salsa.

ingredients.name: oregano
ingredients.original: 2-3 fresh sprigs oregano, or 1 tablespoon dried
ingredients.originalString: 2-3 fresh sprigs oregano, or 1 tablespoon dried
ingredients.originalName: 2-3 fresh sprigs oregano, or 1 tablespoon dried

ingredients.name: jalapeno
ingredients.original: 2 chopped peppers – bell pepper, Anaheim, or jalapeño (your choice, depending on taste for heat), seeds, stems and ribs discarded
ingredients.originalString: 2 chopped peppers – bell pepper, Anaheim, or jalapeño (your choice, depending on taste for heat), seeds, stems and ribs discarded
ingredients.originalName: chopped peppers – bell pepper, Anaheim, or jalapeño (your choice, depending on taste for heat), seeds, stems and ribs discarded

ingredients.name: red chili powder
ingredients.original: 2 tablespoons Ancho red chili sauce, or chili powder or Tabasco to taste*
ingredients.originalString: 2 tablespoons Ancho red chili sauce, or chili powder or Tabasco to taste*
ingredients.originalName: Ancho red chili sauce, or chili powder or Tabasco to taste

ingredients.name: chipotle powder
ingredients.original: 1-2 teaspoons of puréed chipotle in adobo, chipotle Tabasco, or chipotle powder (to taste)
ingredients.originalString: 1-2 teaspoons of puréed chipotle in adobo, chipotle Tabasco, or chipotle powder (to taste)
ingredients.originalName: puréed chipotle in adobo, chipotle Tabasco, or chipotle powder (to taste)

ingredients.name: whole cumin
ingredients.original: 1 tablespoon cumin, (crushed whole toasted cumin seed is best, if possible)
